forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Cloudy, with a low around 50. West wind around 13 mph.

forecast.name: Friday
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly sunny. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 56 in the afternoon. West wind 8 to 12 mph.

weather_report:
Beneath a cool web of clouds, the night in Downtown San Francisco wears a serene cloak of gray. The low temperatures whisper of a gentle chill, as moderate winds carry the promise of the day ahead. As dawn approaches, hints of sunlight begin to pulse through the overcast, presaging a Friday that will flirt with partial sunshine. Expect the warmth to be modest, with a high reaching into the upper fifties, then retreating slightly as afternoon casts its delicate shadows. 

Though the marine layer might clasp its cool and damp grip around the Golden Gate, there’s a distinct clarity in the air today, inviting the metropolis to stretch and breathe. The fog plays coy, lingering at the edges but unable to completely veil the city’s outlines. It’s a time when light layers become your faithful companion — a light jacket or a cozy sweater should serve you well as you wander the streets. Perhaps a meander to one of the local coffee shops will provide a comforting start, or a quiet stroll along the waterfront may reveal the city’s understated beauty as nature rouses from its slumber. In a world that feels both vast and intimate, there is solace to be found in the gentle embrace of this subdued yet inviting day.
